moves.1. e4: This is a strong move. This controls the center and gives room for development.
moves.1... e5: This does the same but also resists my control of the center.
moves.2. Nf3: This attacks the pawn and develops a piece.
moves.2... f6: This is the Damianov's Defense. This is not a good opening for black because this weakens the king-side.
moves.3. Nxe5: Another option is d4. I choose this because this leads to more unpredictable games and has a trap to it.
moves.3... fxe5: Not a good move. Qe7 would be better rather than falling into a trap.
moves.4... Ke7: If g6, Qxe5+ will win the rook. This is worse than losing the rook.
moves.5. Qxe5+: I win the pawn and move his king again.
moves.5... Kf7: The only move, moving towards the corner.
moves.6. Bc4+: This forces the king to move farther.
moves.6... Kg6: An OK move, either way black should lose fast.
moves.8. d4+: I take control of the center with a check.
moves.9. h4: I do not remember what to do here, but I think this is right. I make a discovered check and pressure a pin.
moves.9... d6: I was thinking d5 or Kg7. This loses faster.
moves.10. Bxg5+: I capture and I win fast.
moves.10... Qxg5: If Kg7, Qf7#. If Kh5, g4#.
moves.11. Qxg5#: And I win like that. In this game, you saw an opening trap and the downfall of an opening due to one move.
